  <us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31_StatementEquityComponentsAxis-AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeMember" id="c70808518" unitRef="iso4217-usd" xs:nil="true"/>
  <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70809869">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -27pt; margin: 0 0 0 27pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;In &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; June 2016, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;13,&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x201c;Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;326&lt;/div&gt;): Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments&lt;/div&gt;&amp;#x201d; (&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;13&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;) which amends the FASB's prior guidance on the impairment of financial instruments. The ASU adds to GAAP an impairment model (known as the &amp;#x201c;current expected credit loss model&amp;#x201d;) that is based on expected losses rather than incurred losses.&amp;nbsp;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;13&lt;/div&gt; becomes effective for the Company for annual reporting periods ending after &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 15, 2022, &lt;/div&gt;including interim periods within those fiscal years. The adoption of ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;13&lt;/div&gt; is &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; expected to have a material impact on the Company's consolidated financial statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;In &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; January 2017, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;03&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x201c;Intangibles-Goodwill and Other (Topic &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;350&lt;/div&gt;): Simplifying the Test for Goodwill Impairment&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;(&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;03&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;) effective for periods beginning after &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 15, 2019. &lt;/div&gt;The ASU requires only a &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;one&lt;/div&gt;-step qualitative impairment test, whereby a goodwill impairment loss will be measured as the excess of a reporting unit's carrying amount over its fair value. It eliminates Step &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2&lt;/div&gt; of the prior &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;two&lt;/div&gt;-step goodwill impairment test, under which a goodwill impairment loss was measured by comparing the implied fair value of a reporting unit's goodwill with the carrying amount of that goodwill. The adoption of ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;03&lt;/div&gt; did &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; have a material impact on the results of the Company's goodwill impairment testing procedures.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;In &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; November 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;19,&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;#x201c;Codification Improvements to Topic &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;326,&lt;/div&gt; Financial Instruments-Credit Losses&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp; (&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;19&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;), which clarifies that receivables arising from operating leases are &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; within the scope of the credit losses standard but rather should be accounted for in accordance with the lease standard. ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;19&lt;/div&gt; became effective for the Company for fiscal years beginning after &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 15, 2019, &lt;/div&gt;and interim periods within those fiscal years. The adoption of ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;19&lt;/div&gt; did &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; have a material impact on the Company's consolidated financial statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;In &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 2019, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2019&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;12,&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x201c;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Income Taxes (Topic &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;740&lt;/div&gt;): Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&amp;#x201d;. The standard includes multiple key provisions, including removal of certain exceptions to ASC &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;740,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;, and simplification in several other areas such as accounting for a franchise tax that is partially based on income. ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2019&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;12&lt;/div&gt; is effective for fiscal years beginning after &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 15, 2020, &lt;/div&gt;including interim periods within those fiscal years. The Company is currently assessing the impact of adopting this standard but does &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; expect the adoption of this guidance to have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!-- Field: /Page --&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; background-color: white"&gt;In &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; October 2020, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2020&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;10&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x201c;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Codification Improvements&lt;/div&gt;.&amp;#x201d; The new accounting rules improve the consistency of the Codification by including all disclosure guidance in the appropriate Disclosure Section (Section &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;50&lt;/div&gt;) that had only been included in the Other Presentation Matters Section (Section &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;45&lt;/div&gt;) of the Codification. Additionally, the new rules also clarify guidance across various topics including defined benefit plans, foreign currency transactions, and interest expense. The standard is effective for the Company in the &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;first&lt;/div&gt; quarter of &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2021.&lt;/div&gt; The Company does &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; expect the adoption of the new accounting rules to have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

  <us-gaap:PensionAndOtherPostretirementBenefitsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="s1783177">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;"&gt;Note &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;11.&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Benefit Plans&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;The Company has established a &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;401&lt;/div&gt;(k) Plan for eligible employees of the Company.&amp;nbsp;Generally, all employees of the Company who are at least &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;twenty-one&lt;/div&gt; years of age are eligible to participate in the &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;401&lt;/div&gt;(k) Plan.&amp;nbsp;The &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;401&lt;/div&gt;(k) Plan is a defined contribution plan, which provides that participants &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;make voluntary salary deferral contributions, on a pretax basis, between &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;1%&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;100%&lt;/div&gt; of their compensation in the form of voluntary payroll deductions, up to a maximum amount as indexed for cost-of-living adjustments.&amp;nbsp;The Company &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;make discretionary contributions.&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; discretionary contributions were made during the years ended &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 31, 2020 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2019.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:PensionAndOtherPostretirementBenefitsDisclosureTextBlock>

  <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70809862">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;Property and equipment are stated at cost.&amp;nbsp;Depreciation and amortization, based upon the estimated useful lives (ranging from &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;two&lt;/div&gt; to &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;seven&lt;/div&gt; years) of the assets or terms of the leases, are computed by use of the straight-line method.&amp;nbsp;Leasehold improvements are amortized based upon the shorter of the terms of the leases or asset lives.&amp;nbsp;When property and equipment are retired or sold, the cost and accumulated depreciation and amortization are eliminated from the related accounts and gains or losses, if any, are reflected in the&amp;nbsp;consolidated statement of operations.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;The Company reviews long-lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; be recoverable.&amp;nbsp;If it is determined that impairment has occurred, the amount of the impairment is charged to operations.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c-3">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=" border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center"&gt;December 31, 2020&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-size: 10pt"&gt;December 31, 2019&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; width: 1%"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; width: 1%"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; width: 10%"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline;   <us-gaap:ProvisionForDoubtfulAccounts contextRef="d_2019-01-01_2019-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808557" unitRef="iso4217-usd">11000</us-gaap:ProvisionForDoubtfulAccounts>
  <us-gaap:ReceivablesPolicyTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70809860">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Accounts Receivable and Allowance for Doubtful Accounts&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;Accounts receivable are accounted for at net realizable value, do &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; bear interest and are short-term in nature.&amp;nbsp;The Company maintains an allowance for doubtful accounts for estimated losses resulting from the inability to collect on accounts receivable.&amp;nbsp;Based on management's assessment, the Company provides for estimated uncollectible amounts through a charge to earnings and a credit to the allowance.&amp;nbsp;At &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 31, 2020, &lt;/div&gt;the Company had an allowance of &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$1.6&lt;/div&gt; million, and recorded an &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$0.2&lt;/div&gt; million bad debt charge to earnings. Balances that remain outstanding after the Company has used reasonable collection efforts are written off through a charge to the allowance and a credit to accounts receivable.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company generally does &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; require collateral.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:ReceivablesPolicyTextBlock>

  <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="s1783174">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;"&gt;Note &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;9.&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Related Parties&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;The Executive Chairman of the Company, Mark E. Schwarz, is also the chairman, chief executive officer and portfolio manager of Newcastle Capital Management, L.P. (&amp;#x201c;NCM&amp;#x201d;). NCM is the general partner of Newcastle Partners L.P. (&amp;#x201c;Newcastle&amp;#x201d;), which&amp;nbsp;is the largest shareholder of the Company.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;The Company's corporate headquarters are located at &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;200&lt;/div&gt; Crescent Court, Suite &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;1400,&lt;/div&gt; Dallas, Texas &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;75201,&lt;/div&gt; which are also the offices of NCM. The Company occupies a portion of NCM space on a month-to-month basis at &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$2,500&lt;/div&gt; per month, pursuant to a services agreement entered into between the parties. Pursuant to the services agreement, the Company receives the use of NCM's facilities and equipment and administrative services from employees of NCM. The Company incurred expenses pursuant to the services agreement totaling approximately &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$30&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; thousand for each of the years ended &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 31, 2020 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2019.&lt;/div&gt; The Company did &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; owe NCM any amounts under the services agreement as of &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 31, 2020.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:RepaymentsOfDebt contextRef="d_2020-10-28_2020-10-28_CreditFacilityAxis-TermLoanMember_LineOfCreditFacilityAxis-AmegyMember" decimals="-2" id="c70808746" unitRef="iso4217-usd">600000</us-gaap:RepaymentsOfDebt>
  <us-gaap:RepaymentsOfLongTermDebt contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808587" unitRef="iso4217-usd">1258000</us-gaap:RepaymentsOfLongTermDebt>

  <us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit contextRef="i_2019-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808392" unitRef="iso4217-usd">-60815000</us-gaap:RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31_ProductOrServiceAxis-ServiceMember" decimals="-3" id="c70808400" unitRef="iso4217-usd">41577000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2019-01-01_2019-12-31_ProductOrServiceAxis-ServiceMember" decimals="-3" id="c70808401" unitRef="iso4217-usd">75452000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31_ProductOrServiceAxis-LicenseFeesAndOtherMember" decimals="-3" id="c70808402" unitRef="iso4217-usd">26000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2019-01-01_2019-12-31_ProductOrServiceAxis-LicenseFeesAndOtherMember" decimals="-3" id="c70808403" unitRef="iso4217-usd">52000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808404" unitRef="iso4217-usd">41603000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax contextRef="d_2019-01-01_2019-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808405" unitRef="iso4217-usd">75504000</us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax>
  <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70809857">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;The Company has adopted the requirements of Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#x201c;ASU&amp;#x201d;) &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt; Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;606&lt;/div&gt;) (&amp;#x201c;ASC &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;606&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;). ASC &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;606&lt;/div&gt; establishes a principle for recognizing revenue upon the transfer of promised goods or services to customers, in an amount that reflects the expected consideration received in exchange for those goods or services. The guidance provides a &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;five&lt;/div&gt;-step analysis of transactions to determine when and how revenue is recognized.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;Under the revenue standard, the Company recognizes revenues when its customer obtains control of promised goods or services, in an amount that reflects the consideration which the Company expects to receive in exchange for those goods or services. The Company recognizes revenues following the &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;five&lt;/div&gt;-step model prescribed under ASU &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;09:&lt;/div&gt; (i) identify contract(s) with a customer; (ii) identify the performance obligations in the contract; (iii) determine the transaction price; (iv) allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract; and (v) recognize revenues when (or as) the Company satisfies the performance obligation.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Service Revenues&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;Our service revenues are derived primarily from fashion model bookings and representation of social media influencers and actors for commercials, film, and television. Revenues from services are recognized and related model costs are accrued when the customer obtains control of the Company's product, which occurs at a point in time, typically when the talent has completed the contractual requirement. The Company expenses incremental costs of obtaining a contract as and when incurred because the expected amortization period of the asset that it would have recognized is &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;one&lt;/div&gt; year or less or the amount is immaterial. Our performance obligations are primarily satisfied at a point in time when the talent has completed the contractual requirements.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;A contract's transaction price is allocated to each distinct performance obligation and recognized as revenue when, or as, the performance obligation is satisfied. The performance obligations for most of the Company's core modeling bookings are satisfied on the day of the event, and the &amp;#x201c;day rate&amp;#x201d; total fee is agreed in advance, when the customer books the model for a particular date. For contracts with multiple performance obligations (which are typically all satisfied within &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;1&lt;/div&gt; to &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;3&lt;/div&gt; days), we allocate the contract's transaction price to each performance obligation based on the estimated relative standalone selling price.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;When reporting service revenue gross as a principal versus net as an agent, the Company assesses whether the Company, the model or the talent is the primary obligor.&amp;nbsp;The Company evaluates the terms of its model, talent and client agreements as part of this assessment.&amp;nbsp;In addition, the Company gives appropriate consideration to other key indicators such as latitude in establishing price, discretion in model or talent selection and credit risk the Company undertakes.&amp;nbsp;The Company operates broadly as a modeling agency and in those relationships with models and talents where the key indicators suggest the Company acts as a principal, the Company records the gross amount billed to the client as revenue, when the revenues are earned and collectability is probable, and the related costs incurred to the model or talent as model or talent cost.&amp;nbsp;In other model and talent relationships, where the Company believes the key indicators suggest the Company acts as an agent on behalf of the model or talent, the Company records revenue, when the revenues are earned and collectability is probable, net of pass-through model or talent cost.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0 0 8pt; color: #212529"&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 32 --&gt; &lt;!-- Field: /Page --&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0 0 8pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; color: #212529"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; background-color: white"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;License Fees&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; color: #212529; background-color: white"&gt;License fees,&lt;/div&gt; in connection with the licensing of the &amp;#x201c;Wilhelmina&amp;#x201d; name, are collected on a monthly or quarterly basis under the terms of Wilhelmina's agreements with licensees. The Company recognizes revenue relating to license fees where payment is deemed to be probable, over the license period.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Contract Assets&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;Contract assets, which primarily relate to the Company's right to consideration for work completed but &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; billed at the reporting date are included within accounts receivable and approximated &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$0.1&lt;/div&gt; million and &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;$2.1&lt;/div&gt; million at &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt; December 31, 2020 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"&gt;2019,&lt;/div&gt; respectively.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Advances to Models&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;Advances to models for the cost of initial portfolios and other out-of-pocket costs, which are reimbursable only from collections from the Company's clients as a result of future work, are expensed to model costs as incurred net of such costs that are expected to be recouped.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:RightOfUseAssetObtainedInExchangeForFinanceLeaseLiability contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70808830" unitRef="iso4217-usd" xs:nil="true"/>
  <us-gaap:RightOfUseAssetObtainedInExchangeForFinanceLeaseLiability contextRef="d_2019-01-01_2019-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808831" unitRef="iso4217-usd">452000</us-gaap:RightOfUseAssetObtainedInExchangeForFinanceLeaseLiability>
  <us-gaap:RightOfUseAssetObtainedInExchangeForOperatingLeaseLiability contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" decimals="-3" id="c70808832" unitRef="iso4217-usd">332000</us-gaap:RightOfUseAssetObtainedInExchangeForOperatingLeaseLiability>

  <us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy contextRef="d_2020-01-01_2020-12-31" id="c70809867">&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;div style="display: inline; font-style: italic;"&gt;Share-Based Compensation&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0"&gt;The Company utilizes share-based awards as a form of compensation for certain officers. The Company records compensation expense for all awards granted.&amp;nbsp;The Company uses the Black-Scholes valuation model and straight-line amortization of compensation expense over the requisite service period for each separately vesting portion of the grants.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy>
