							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else { e.nextSibling.style.display='none'; }
							}</script>
</head>
<body>
<span style="display: none;">v3.20.4</span><table class="report" border="0" cellspacing="2" id="idm140357968098296">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Note 6 - Commitments and Contingencies<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">12 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Dec. 31, 2020</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_DisclosureTextBlockAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to Financial Statements</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Commitments and Contingencies Disclosure [Text Block]</a></td>
<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">6.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Commitments and Contingencies</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0 0 0pt">On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> October 24, 2013, </div>a putative class action lawsuit was brought against the Company by former Wilhelmina model Alex Shanklin and others, including Louisa Raske, Carina Vretman, Grecia Palomares and Michelle Griffin Trotter (the &#x201c;Shanklin Litigation&#x201d;), in New York State Supreme Court (New York County)&nbsp;by the same lead&nbsp;counsel who represented plaintiffs in a prior, now-dismissed action brought by Louisa Raske (the &#x201c;Raske Litigation&#x201d;).&nbsp; The claims in the Shanklin Litigation initially included breach of contract and unjust enrichment allegations arising out of matters similar to the Raske Litigation, such as the handling and reporting of funds on behalf&nbsp;of models and the use of model images.&nbsp; Other parties&nbsp;named as defendants in the Shanklin Litigation include other model management companies, advertising firms, and certain advertisers.&nbsp; On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> January 6, 2014, </div>the Company moved to dismiss the Amended Complaint in the Shanklin Litigation for failure to state a claim upon which relief can be granted and other grounds, and other defendants also filed motions to dismiss.&nbsp; On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> August 11, 2014, </div>the court denied the motion to dismiss as to Wilhelmina and other of the model management defendants.&nbsp; Separately, on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> March 3, 2014, </div>the judge assigned to the Shanklin Litigation wrote the Office of the New York Attorney General bringing the case to&nbsp;its attention, generally describing the claims asserted therein against the model management defendants, and stating that the case <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> &#x201c;may </div>involve matters in the public interest.&#x201d;&nbsp;The judge's letter also enclosed a copy of his decision in the Raske Litigation, which dismissed that case.&nbsp;</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">Plaintiffs retained substitute counsel, who filed a Second and then Third Amended Complaint.&nbsp;Plaintiffs' Third Amended Complaint asserts causes of action for alleged breaches of the plaintiffs' management contracts with the defendants, conversion, breach of the duty of good faith and fair dealing, and unjust enrichment.&nbsp; The Third Amended Complaint also alleges that the plaintiff models were at all relevant times employees, and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> independent contractors, of the model management defendants, and that defendants violated the New York Labor Law in several respects, including, among other things, by allegedly failing to pay the models the minimum wages and overtime pay required thereunder, <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> maintaining accurate payroll records, and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> providing plaintiffs with full explanations of how their wages and deductions therefrom were computed.&nbsp; The Third Amended Complaint seeks certification of the action as a class action, damages in an amount to be determined at trial, plus interest, costs, attorneys' fees, and such other relief as the court deems proper.&nbsp; On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> October 6, 2015, </div>Wilhelmina filed a motion to dismiss as to most of the plaintiffs' claims.&nbsp; The Court entered a decision granting in part and denying in part Wilhelmina's motion to dismiss on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> May 26, 2017.&nbsp; </div>The Court (i) dismissed <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">three</div> of the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">five</div> New York Labor Law causes of action, along with the conversion, breach of the duty of good faith and fair dealing and unjust enrichment causes of action, in their entirety, and (ii) permitted only the breach of contract causes of action, and some plaintiffs' remaining <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">two</div> New York Labor Law causes of action to continue, within a limited time frame.&nbsp; The plaintiffs&nbsp;and Wilhelmina&nbsp;each appealed, and the decision was affirmed on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> May 24, 2018.&nbsp;</div>On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> August 16, 2017,&nbsp;</div>Wilhelmina timely filed its Answer to the Third Amended Complaint.</div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> June 6, 2016, </div>another putative class action lawsuit was brought against the Company by former Wilhelmina model Shawn Pressley and others, including Roberta Little (the &#x201c;Pressley Litigation&#x201d;), in New York State Supreme Court (New York County) by the same counsel representing the plaintiffs in the Shanklin Litigation, and asserting identical, although more recent, claims as those in the Shanklin Litigation.&nbsp; The Amended Complaint, asserting essentially the same types of claims as in the Shanklin action, was filed on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> August 16, 2017.&nbsp; </div>Wilhelmina filed a motion to dismiss the Amended Complaint on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> September 29, 2017, </div>which was granted in part and denied in part on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> May 10, 2018. &nbsp;</div>Some New York Labor Law and contract claims remain in the case.&nbsp; Pressley has withdrawn from the case, leaving Roberta Little as the sole remaining named plaintiff in the Pressley Litigation. &nbsp;On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> July 12, 2019, </div>the Company filed its Answer and Counterclaim against Little.</div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> May 1, 2019, </div>the Plaintiffs in the Shanklin Litigation (except Raske) and the Pressley Litigation filed motions for class certification on their contract claims and the remaining New York Labor Law Claims. On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> July 12, 2019, </div>Wilhelmina filed its opposition to the motions for class certification and filed a cross-motion for summary judgment against Shanklin, Vretman, Palomares, Trotter and Little, and a motion for summary judgment against Raske.&nbsp;</div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0 0 0pt">By Order Dated <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> May 8, 2020 (</div>the &#x201c;Class Certification Order&#x201d;), the Court denied class certification in the Pressley case, denied class certification with respect to the breach of contract and alleged unpaid usage claims, granted class certification as to the New York Labor Law causes of action asserted by Vretman, Palomares and Trotter, and declined to rule on Wilhelmina's motions for summary judgment, denying them without prejudice to be re-filed at a later date. On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> June 12, 2020, </div>the Plaintiffs in both the Shanklin and Pressley actions filed Notices of Appeal to the Appellate Division, First Department, from those portions of the Class Certification Order on which Wilhelmina prevailed. On <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> June 22, 2020, </div>Wilhelmina filed Notices of Cross-Appeal from those portions of the Class Certification order that granted class Certification and denied summary judgment. The Court has directed the parties to non-binding mediation and that process is underway.</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0 0 0pt">The Company believes the claims asserted in the Shanklin Litigation and Pressley Litigation are without merit and intends to continue to vigorously defend the actions.</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div>   <!-- Field: /Page --> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">In addition to the legal proceedings disclosed herein, the Company is also engaged in various legal proceedings that are routine in nature and incidental to its business. <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">None</div> of these routine proceedings, either individually or in the aggregate, are believed likely, in the Company's opinion, to have a material adverse effect on its consolidated financial position or its results of operations.</div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Note 7 - Income Taxes<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">12 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Dec. 31, 2020</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_DisclosureTextBlockAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to Financial Statements</strong></a></td>

<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Income Tax Disclosure [Text Block]</a></td>
<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">7.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Taxes</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">The following table summarizes the income tax (expense) benefit&nbsp;for the years ended <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019</div> (in thousands):</div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div> <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; min-width: 700px;">    <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt">State</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(91</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(58</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="padding-left: 10pt; font-size: 10pt">Foreign</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">-</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">-</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">  <td style="padding-left: 10pt; font-size: 10pt">Deferred Total</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(724</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt">Effective tax rate</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">22.3</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">%</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">9.1</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">%</td>  </tr>    </table> </div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Company reported income tax expense of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.9</div> million for <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2020</div> despite a pre-tax loss. The expense was primarily due to a <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$1.5</div> million valuation allowance recorded against deferred tax assets. The valuation allowance was the result of management's assessment as of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>that it was <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> more likely than <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> that the benefit of the Company's deferred tax assets would be realized primarily due to the impact of the COVID-<div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">19</div> pandemic on its business. Income tax expense for <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2020</div> was also impacted by foreign taxes in the United Kingdom related to the Company's London office that are <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> deductible for U.S. income tax purposes. In addition, the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.8</div> million goodwill impairment recorded in <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2020</div> resulted in only a <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.1</div> million tax benefit due to certain permanent tax differences.</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Company reported income tax expense of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.4</div> million for <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019</div> despite a pre-tax loss due primarily to a <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.3</div> million valuation allowance recorded against deferred tax assets related to forfeited stock options. Income tax expense for <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019</div> was also impacted by foreign taxes in the United Kingdom related to the Company's London office that are <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> deductible for U.S. income tax purposes. In addition, the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$4.8</div> million goodwill impairment recorded in <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019</div> resulted in only a <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.3</div> million tax benefit due to certain permanent tax differences.</div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"></div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div>   <!-- Field: /Page --> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(340</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Total deferred income tax asset</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">782</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1,733</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">Deferred tax liability:</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Property and equipment</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(159</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(393</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Right of use asset</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(136</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(391</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Intangible assets-brand name</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(1,197</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(1,079</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-left: 0.25in">Goodwill</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(288</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(257</div></td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Other intangible assets</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(451</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(338</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; padding-left: 0.25in">Total deferred income tax liability</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(2,231</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(2,458</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; padding-left: 0.25in">Net deferred tax liability</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">$</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(1,449</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">$</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(725</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>    </table> </div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0 0 0pt">The presentation of net deferred tax assets and liabilities are presented as noncurrent within the Company's Consolidated Balance Sheets. Deferred income tax balances reflect the effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities and their tax bases and are stated at enacted tax rates expected to be in effect when the taxes are actually paid or recovered. The Company recognizes a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets when it is more likely than <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> that these assets will <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> be realized. In making this determination, all positive and negative evidence is considered, including future reversals of existing taxable temporary differences, tax planning strategies, future taxable income, and taxable income in prior carryback years.</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0 0 0pt">At <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2019, </div>the Company has <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$4.3</div> million and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.5</div> million, respectively, of federal net operating loss carryforwards, of which <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.5</div></div> million expires in <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2037</div> and the remainder do <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> expire. Additionally, the Company has <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.5</div> million of U.S. federal foreign tax credit carryforwards, which expire between <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2023</div> and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2029.</div></div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">The Company does <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> believe that it had any significant uncertain tax positions at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2019, </div>nor is this expected to change within the next <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">twelve</div> months due to the settlement and expiration of statutes of limitation.</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">The U.S. Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the &#x201c;Tax Act&#x201d;) was enacted on <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 22, 2017 </div>and introduced significant changes to U.S. income tax law. Effective in <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2018,</div> the Tax Act reduced the U.S. statutory tax rate from <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">35%</div> to <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">21%</div> and created new taxes on certain foreign-sourced earnings and certain related-party payments, which are referred to as the global intangible low-taxed income tax and base erosion tax, respectively. In <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> January 2018, </div>the FASB released guidance on the accounting for tax on the global intangible low-taxed income (&#x201c;GILTI&#x201d;) provisions of the Tax Act. The GILTI provisions impose a tax on foreign income in excess of a deemed return on tangible assets of foreign corporations. The Company elected to treat any potential GILTI inclusions as a period cost.</div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for income taxes. Disclosures may include net deferred tax liability or asset recognized in an enterprise's statement of financial position, net change during the year in the total valuation allowance, approximate tax effect of each type of temporary difference and carryforward that gives rise to a significant portion of deferred tax liabilities and deferred tax assets, utilization of a tax carryback, and tax uncertainties information.</p></div>

<span style="display: none;">v3.20.4</span><table class="report" border="0" cellspacing="2" id="idm140358042186200">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Note 8 - Treasury Stock<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">12 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Dec. 31, 2020</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_DisclosureTextBlockAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to Financial Statements</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_TreasuryStockTextBlock', window );">Treasury Stock [Text Block]</a></td>
<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">8.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Treasury Stock</div></div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">&nbsp;</div></div> <div style=" margin: 0 0 0pt; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">During <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2012,</div> the Board of Directors authorized a stock repurchase program whereby the Company could repurchase up to <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">500,000</div> shares of its outstanding common stock. During <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2013,</div> the Board of Directors renewed and extended the Company's share repurchase authority to enable it to repurchase up to an aggregate of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1,000,000</div> shares of common stock. In <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2016,</div> the Board of Directors increased by an additional <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">500,000</div> shares the number of shares of the Company's common stock, which <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> may </div>be repurchased under its stock repurchase program to an aggregate of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1,500,000</div> shares. The shares <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> may </div>be repurchased from time to time in the open market or through privately negotiated transactions at prices the Company deems appropriate. The program does <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> obligate the Company to acquire any particular amount of common stock and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> may </div>be modified or suspended at any time at the Company's discretion.</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">From <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2012</div> through <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020, </div>the Company repurchased an aggregate of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1,314,694</div> shares of common stock at an average price of approximately <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$4.85</div> per share, for a total of approximately <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$6.4</div> million in repurchases under the stock repurchase program. During the year ended <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020, </div><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">4,833</div> shares were repurchased at an average price of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$4.04</div> per share. The repurchase of an additional <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">185,306</div> shares is presently authorized under the stock repurchase program.</div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_TreasuryStockTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for treasury stock, including, but not limited to, average cost per share, description of share repurchase program, shares repurchased, shares held for each class of treasury stock.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://fasb.org/us-gaap/role/ref/legacyRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 505<br> -SubTopic 30<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/subtopic&amp;trid=2208821<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Related Party Transactions Disclosure [Text Block]</a></td>
<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">9.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Related Parties</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">The Executive Chairman of the Company, Mark E. Schwarz, is also the chairman, chief executive officer and portfolio manager of Newcastle Capital Management, L.P. (&#x201c;NCM&#x201d;). NCM is the general partner of Newcastle Partners L.P. (&#x201c;Newcastle&#x201d;), which&nbsp;is the largest shareholder of the Company.</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">The Company's corporate headquarters are located at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">200</div> Crescent Court, Suite <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1400,</div> Dallas, Texas <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">75201,</div> which are also the offices of NCM. The Company occupies a portion of NCM space on a month-to-month basis at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$2,500</div> per month, pursuant to a services agreement entered into between the parties. Pursuant to the services agreement, the Company receives the use of NCM's facilities and equipment and administrative services from employees of NCM. The Company incurred expenses pursuant to the services agreement totaling approximately <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$30</div></div> thousand for each of the years ended <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div> The Company did <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">not</div> owe NCM any amounts under the services agreement as of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020.</div></div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for related party transactions. Examples of related party transactions include transactions between (a) a parent company and its subsidiary; (b) subsidiaries of a common parent; (c) and entity and its principal owners; and (d) affiliates.</p></div>

<th class="th" colspan="1">12 Months Ended</th>

<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_DisclosureTextBlockAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to Financial Statements</strong></a></td>

</td>

<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-gaap_DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock', window );">Share-based Payment Arrangement [Text Block]</a></td>
<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">10.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock Options and Stock Purchase Warrants</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">During <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2015,</div> shareholders of the Company approved the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2015</div> Incentive Plan which authorized the issuance of up to an <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">500,000</div> shares of the common stock pursuant to stock options, restricted stock, stock appreciation rights and other equity incentives awarded to directors, officers, consultants, advisors and employees of the Company. Stock option awards under the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2015</div> Incentive Plan are granted at the market value of the common stock on the date of grant, have vesting periods of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">five</div> years, and expire to the extent unexercised after <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">ten</div> years.</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">Under the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2015</div> Incentive Plan, <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">no</div></div> stock option awards were granted during <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2020</div> or <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div> <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">No</div></div> stock options were exercised during either <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2020</div> or <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">The following table shows a summary of stock option transactions under the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2015</div> Incentive Plan during <div style="display: inline; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(400,000</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">Outstanding, December 31, 2020</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">60,000</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  </tr>    </table> </div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"></div> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: 0.5in">Weighted average remaining contractual life was <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">5.83</div> years at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">6.61</div> years at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2019. </div>The exercise price of all stock options was below the market value at both <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div> Therefore, there is <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">no</div></div> intrinsic value at <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div> Total unrecognized compensation expense on options outstanding as of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>was <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$8</div> thousand. Options to purchase <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">42,000</div> shares of common stock were exercisable as of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020.</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div>   <!-- Field: /Page --> <div style=" margin: 0; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">The Company estimates the fair value of each stock option granted on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. Expected volatilities are based on the historical volatility of Wilhelmina's and similar companies' common stock for a period equal to the expected term. The risk-free interest rates for periods within the contractual term of the options are based on rates for U.S. Treasury Notes with maturity dates corresponding to the options' expected lives on the dates of grant. Expected term is determined based on the option term of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">ten</div> years.</div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">

<td class="text"><div style="display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt"><div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"><div style="display: inline; font-weight: bold;">Note <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">11.</div>&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefit Plans</div></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in; margin: 0">The Company has established a <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">401</div>(k) Plan for eligible employees of the Company.&nbsp;Generally, all employees of the Company who are at least <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">twenty-one</div> years of age are eligible to participate in the <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">401</div>(k) Plan.&nbsp;The <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">401</div>(k) Plan is a defined contribution plan, which provides that participants <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> may </div>make voluntary salary deferral contributions, on a pretax basis, between <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">1%</div> and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">100%</div> of their compensation in the form of voluntary payroll deductions, up to a maximum amount as indexed for cost-of-living adjustments.&nbsp;The Company <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> may </div>make discretionary contributions.&nbsp;<div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">No</div></div> discretionary contributions were made during the years ended <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 31, 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">2019.</div></div></div><span></span>

font-style: italic; font: inherit;">(800</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">)</td>  </tr>  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">Balance as of December 31, 2020</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">$</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">6,918</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">$</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">629</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">$</td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: right"><div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">7,547</div></td>  <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left">&nbsp;</td>  </tr>    </table> </div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0">&nbsp;</div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0"></div> <div style=" font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">In <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> March 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 2019, </div>the Company determined there were triggering events, primarily caused by a sustained decrease in the Company's stock price. The results of the goodwill impairment tests indicated that the carrying values exceeded the estimated fair values. Thus, during <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> March 2020 </div>and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;"> December 2019, </div>the Company recorded impairment charges of <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$0.8</div> million and <div style="display: inline; font-style: italic; font: inherit;">$4.8</div> million, respectively, related to its goodwill. Further declines in the Company's stock price could result in additional goodwill impairment charges.</div></div><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
